Properties.Name: Text
Properties.Value:
This workflow synchronizes customers from Sage Intacct to Autotask.
It fetches customer records from Sage, splits them into individual records, and checks whether each has already been processed against a Key-Value. 
If a customer does not exist in Autotask, the Workflow maps the data into the required format, creates the customer in Autotask, and logs the result of each operationâ€”whether successful or failed.

Nodes.Name: VariableBar
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are setting the Key Value Group

Nodes.Name: Formatter
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are displaying a message if the Customer has already been processed

Nodes.Name: SetKeyValue2
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here we are logging the Key Value record for successful records.
We get the Group from the Variable bar.
We use the Customer ID as the Key (Notice the fx on the input - you need to select which field in the payload is the Key.)
We use the Autotask Response EntityID as the Value

Nodes.Name: SageIntacct
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are retrieving a list of Sage Intacct Customers limited to 5 for the purposes of this sample

Properties.Schema:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16"?>
<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="Request">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="object" type="xs:string" />
        <xs:element name="fields" type="xs:string" />
        <xs:element name="query" />
        <xs:element name="pagesize" type="xs:unsignedByte" />
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>
Properties.Name: Request

Nodes.Name: ForEach
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are splitting the Customers to be processed into individual records

Nodes.Name: GetKeyValue2
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we check to see if the Customer has been processed before by checking if a Key Value record has already been logged for this Customer ID.

Nodes.Name: QuickMap
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here we map the Customer data retrieved from Shopify to the Autotask format before creating the customer record in Autotask.
Both JSON and XML document types are utilized in this step.

Nodes.Name: Autotask
Nodes.LongDescription: Here we are creating the Customer record in Autotask

Properties.Schema:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-16"?>
<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="create">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="Entities">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="Entity">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="AccountID" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="FirstName" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="LastName" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="MiddleInitial" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="Title" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="AddressLine" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="AddressLine1" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="City" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="State" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="ZipCode" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="Country" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="EMailAddress" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="EMailAddress2" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="EMailAddress3" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="Notification" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="Phone" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="Extension" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="AlternatePhone" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="MobilePhone" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="FaxNumber" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="Note" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="RoomNumber" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="Active" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="AdditionalAddressInformation" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="ExternalID" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="CountryID" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="BulkEmailOptOut" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="NamePrefix" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="NameSuffix" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="FacebookUrl" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="TwitterUrl" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="LinkedInUrl" type="xs:string" />
                    <xs:element name="PrimaryContact" type="xs:string" />
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>

Nodes.Name: IfVisualBasic
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here we are checking if the customer has been created in Autotask by validating against the Autotask Response.

Response: Contains an EntityID indicating a successful creation.
The EntityID is used as the Value when logging Successful records.
Blank Response: Indicates error creating Customer

Nodes.Name: SetKeyValue2
Nodes.LongDescription:
Here we are logging the Key Value record for error records.
We get the Group from the Variable bar.
We use the Customer ID as the Key (Notice the fx on the input - you need to select which field in the payload is the Key.)

Name: Sage Intacct Customers To Autotask
Description: This Workflow syncs customers from Sage Intacct to Autotask by checking each record against a Key-Value. New customers are mapped, created in Autotask, and the result is logged per record.
